conditions.weatherComment: Dry overnight. Some sunshine and light showers with a 15mph NW wind (gusts @ 30mph) & a high of 6c
conditions.other:
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
WEIGHING ROOM ACCESS. Proof of a negative lateral flow test will be required for access to the weighing room, where social distancing measures remain in place. The wearing of masks is highly recommended too.
TRACK MAINTENANCE. The track will be harrowed to a depth of 4" and reinstated with a gallop master finish

FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.

conditions.stablingComment:
Owners - Covid passes or negative lateral flow tests are required for owners attending this meeting. Face masks are no longer mandatory in the Parade Ring – it is individual choice.

The Welsh Government has now relaxed social distancing rules inside and there are no limits on the number of people who can sit on a table in the Owners and Trainers facilities.

Stabling
Please book any specific stabling requirements through djones@ffoslasracecourse.com
All travellers / companions must also be booked in advance and those that have not raced in the last 4 days or are not entered to run in the subsequent 4 days will incur a £20 charge.
conditions.bookingComment: There will be limited accommodation available on first come first serve basis, please book early with Clerk of Course.

conditions.weatherComment: Dry overnight. Remaining cloudy today with a 20mph WNW wind and a high of 12c
conditions.other:
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
WEIGHING ROOM ACCESS. Proof of a negative lateral flow test will be required for access to the weighing room, where social distancing measures remain in place. The wearing of masks is highly recommended too.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 3 1/2" and reinstated with a gallopmaster finish.

FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.

conditions.weatherComment:
Monday: Mostly dry but cloudy today. Brighter in the east. Maximum temperature 9 °C.
Tuesday: Dry in the east with a few clear spells giving a touch of frost in places. Minimum temperature 3 °C.
Outlook: Turning windy on Wednesday with possible rain arriving late in the day. Bright, windy and cold on Thursday with a few showers. Mainly dry and cloudy on Friday.
Long Range: A largely cloudy start to this period for all. After a possibly brighter but colder start in the north. Temperatures are likely to be close to average in the south, whereas milder in the north. Settled conditions looking to continue to dominate through the period.

conditions.weatherComment:
Outlook: Mainly dry and bright Sunday with some sunny spells. Rather more cloud at times Monday and Tuesday. 
Long Range: A largely cloudy start to this period for all. After a possibly brighter but colder start in the north. Temperatures are likely to be close to average in the south, whereas milder in the north. Settled conditions looking to continue to dominate through the period. Heading into February, this settled theme is likely to remain, with drier than average conditions for most.

conditions.groundComment: There is rain forecast today, but the start time now varies between forecasters, from 9am to noon to 4pm! If no rain, ground will probably ride slower and sticker than it walks.
conditions.rails: A1 bend is back on its innermost / official line. The Away Chase bend is also back on its innermost / official line.  The Away hurdle bend is out 20 yards from the innermost / official line adding approx. 60 yards per circuit. Race distances increased as per the summary.
conditions.weatherComment:
1.5mm rain on Sunday night and very strong winds. Dry and very breezy on Monday and Tuesday.  Overcast and calmer on Wednesday. Dry, calm and overcast all day Thursday. Dry & bright on Friday, but cooler day with a stiff breeze.  Dry overnight into Saturday, with light breeze.
Forecast: Rain & winds (gusty at times) are forecast for Saturday, but the start time varies from 9am to noon to 4pm, so it is hard to be certain exactly what we'll get, possibly up to 10mm in total.
conditions.other:
The requirement for all Participants who need weighing room access to undertake a LATERAL FLOW TEST on the morning of racing, and submit their results to the NHS website remains in operation. Therefore, please ensure you have your LFT results to hand when you first arrive at the Weighing Room entrance.

Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)

conditions.weatherComment:
1.5mm rain on Sunday night and very strong winds. Dry and very breezy on Monday and Tuesday.  Overcast and calmer on Wednesday. Dry, calm and overcast all day Thursday. Dry overnight into Friday and then a brighter, but cooler day with a stiff breeze.
Forecast: it is expected to be dry for the remainder of Friday and overnight into Saturday, but then there is rain forecast for Saturday now.  The start time varies with some forecasts suggesting from 10/11am and other from mid afternoon, with up to 6mm to fall before the end of racing. Some gusty winds forecast as well.

conditions.rails: A1 bend is back on its innermost / official line. The Away Chase bend is also back on its innermost / official line.  The Away hurdle bend is out 20 yards from the innermost / official line adding approx. 60 yards per circuit. Race distances increased as per the summary.
conditions.weatherComment:
1.5mm rain on Sunday night and very strong winds. Dry and very breezy on Monday and Tuesday.  Overcast and calmer on Wednesday. 
Forecast: Possibility of 1-1.5mm rain on both Weds / Thurs night and again on Thurs / Friday nights, otherwise it is set to be overcast, dry & settled, with a light breeze during the day, with temps remaining in the 8C - 10C.
conditions.other:
The requirement for all Participants who need weighing room access to undertake a LATERAL FLOW TEST on the morning of racing, and submit their results to the NHS website remains in operation. Therefore, please ensure you have your LFT results to hand when you first arrive at the Weighing Room entrance.

Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)
conditions.bookingComment: No overnight accommodation available onsite, but off-site accommodation can be arranged if required. However, given current Covid situation please email jonjo@wetherbyracing.co.uk ASAP to assist with the booking process.

data.weather: 1.5mm rain on Sunday night and very strong winds. Dry and very breezy on Monday and Tuesday. Overcast and calmer on Wednesday. Dry, calm and overcast all day Thursday. Dry & bright on Friday, but cooler day with a stiff breeze. Dry overnight into Saturday, with light breeze. Forecast: Rain & winds (gusty at times) are forecast for Saturday, but the start time varies from 9am to noon to 4pm, so it is hard to be certain exactly what we'll get, possibly up to 10mm in total.
data.other: The requirement for all Participants who need weighing room access to undertake a LATERAL FLOW TEST on the morning of racing, and submit their results to the NHS website remains in operation. Therefore, please ensure you have your LFT results to hand when you first arrive at the Weighing Room entrance. Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)
data.rail: A1 bend is back on its innermost / official line. The Away Chase bend is also back on its innermost / official line.  The Away hurdle bend is out 20 yards from the innermost / official line adding approx. 60 yards per circuit. Race distances increased as per the summary.
data.weatherText: 1.5mm rain on Sunday night and very strong winds. Dry and very breezy on Monday and Tuesday. Overcast and calmer on Wednesday. Dry, calm and overcast all day Thursday. Dry & bright on Friday, but cooler day with a stiff breeze. Dry overnight into Saturday, with light breeze. Forecast: Rain & winds (gusty at times) are forecast for Saturday, but the start time varies from 9am to noon to 4pm, so it is hard to be certain exactly what we'll get, possibly up to 10mm in total.
data.goingText: Good There is rain forecast today, but the start time now varies between forecasters, from 9am to noon to 4pm! If no rain, ground will probably ride slower and sticker than it walks.

conditions.rails:
Hurdles on Inner Course
All bends out by 2 yards, except Chase adjacent to 2m4f Start, which is on innermost line.

conditions.weatherComment: 9mm rain Sunday. Today should be mainly dry with a 10mph SW wind & a high of 9c
conditions.other:
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are currently unable to provide transport to the starts. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
WEIGHING ROOM ACCESS. Proof of a negative lateral flow test will be required for access to the weighing room, where social distancing measures remain in place. The wearing of masks is highly recommended too.
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 4" & reinstated with a gallop master finish.

FACE COVERINGS. Face coverings are now mandatory in all former green zone areas including the weighing room, (pre) parade ring, horse walk, stables, saddling boxes and at the start (incl. jockeys). Every individual working in or entering these areas, including weighing room personnel, Officials, Trainers, Owners, Jockeys and guests will be required to wear a face covering.
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the starts due to the current Covid restrictions. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.  
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
conditions.stablingComment: COMPANIONS must be booked immediately after declarations with the Clerk of the Course

conditions.weatherComment: Dry overnight. Today will see some sunny spells but a risk of showers remains with a 20mph SSW wind & a high of 7c
conditions.other:
TRANSPORT TO THE STARTS: We are unable to provide transport to the start. Please see notices opposite track exits regards pedestrian use of the service road.
OWNERS BADGES. Owners badges should be booked via the PASS by 4pm the day before racing.
WEIGHING ROOM ACCESS. Proof of a negative lateral flow test will be required for access to the weighing room, where social distancing measures remain in place. The wearing of masks is highly recommended too
TRACK MAINTENANCE: The track will be harrowed to a depth of 3" & reinstated with a gallop master finish

conditions.groundComment: Third last chase fence omitted for all chase races
conditions.rails:
Winning line through to Exeter Bend out 10yds. Hurdles remain in central positions.
Shared Exeter bend: hurdle out 18yds adding 45yds. Chase looses 14yds. 
Separate Plymouth home-turn bends: hurdle out 10yds adding 27.5yds. Chase innermost true line.
Total yardage amendments: plus 75yds hurdle circuit, minus 14yds chase circuit.
conditions.weatherComment:
Showers begun at 8pm Saturday night with 18mm so far.
 set for prolonged wind and rain during racing
conditions.other:
There will be a spectator marquee in the centre of the racecourse beside the canter down.

A negative LFT result will be required
for weighing room access with wristbands allocated on arrival.
Entrances will be reduced to the main front door only, to ensure
everyone passes through our screening process.

Dry, cool and breezy last Thursday. Dry, overcast and calm on Friday. 10mm rain over the duration of Saturday and through to Sunday morning. Further 4mm of rain in showers on Sunday afternoon / evening. 6mm rain fell on Monday morning, followed by a dry afternoon. 1mm rain overnight into Tuesday. Dry on Tuesday with sunny spells during the afternoon. 1.5mm rain overnight into Wednesday.
Warm and breezy start to Wednesday.  Dry and blustery morning, with sunny spells.  Rain is then forecast from 1pm and set to last throughout the afternoon.  Wind speed of around 25mph, with gusts up to 40mph during the afternoon.

Dry on Tuesday with sunny spells during the afternoon. 1.5mm rain overnight into Wednesday. Warm and breezy start to Wednesday. Dry and blustery morning, with sunny spells. Rain is then forecast from 1pm and set to last throughout the afternoon. Wind speed of around 25mph, with gusts up to 40mph during the afternoon.
data.railText: A1 bend 4yds out from its innermost / official line, adding 12yds per circuit. The Away Chase bend is remains on its innermost / official line and the Away hurdle bend remains 20 yards out from the innermost / official line adding approx. 60 yards per circuit. Race distances increased as per the summary.
data.otherText: Head Groundsman: Ian Ward (07880 722586)
